body:
@granthenke I'm not sure I'll have time to get to it today, but I can review it by wed. To answer your question above, it doesn't matter if the read is stale if you're using a conditional set, then the write won't go through if the version isn't the one expected. In the worst case, the broker will have to try it again.

One thing you can goto reduce the probability of a stale read is to issue a sync request right before the read. This way you'll be forcing all pending updates from the leader to the follower to go through. You can't completely avoid the issue though because you can still have concurrent writes even when syncing.

@fpj Thanks for the follow up and confirmation. Using the versioned requests is the approach I took in the "rewrite" after my initial question where I mentioned you. 

I had considered sending a sync request, and would still like to add that, but unfortunately the ZkClient we use does not support it. It also doesn't support a versioned delete request, which is unfortunate. Perhaps I should open a PR for that.
@granthenke I'll see if I can suggest something concrete, but in the past I've bypassed zkclient and used the zk handle directly, it might be doable in your case as well.
@gwenshap could you help with reviewing this trivial change. I have pinged the user who created the JIRA to review as well, could not find his github id.

Excellent improvement :)
LGTM
LGTM
LGTM. Thanks for contributing! This will be very useful.

@granthenke Thank you for the review. I have only addressed default classes in this PR. For configuring non-default classes, partition assignment strategy and the new interceptor property need to be fixed so that they can handle list of classes. Not sure if that needs a KIP, but it will definitely be useful to add integration tests, system tests etc. to make sure the whole functionality works under OSGi. I am happy to work on this, but I thought it will be good the get the default classloading work initially and get some feedback. Thoughts?
@gwenshap another trivial patch, would appreciate your feedback. The JIRA has some discussion that might be of some interest.
@apovzner, who will be reviewing this? @granders and/or @ewencp?
@sslavic @gwenshap mind reviewing this.
LGTM, cc @hachikuji @junrao
This seems OK to me, but it would be good to get input from someone who knows this code better.

A couple more things that we need:
- [x] Update `upgrade.html` to mention that old clients need to upgrade to 0.9.0.1 before the brokers are upgraded to 0.10.0.x.
- [x] System tests must pass.

@granthenke @vahidhashemian I think the intention of the JIRA was to remove redundant code generating zk path for common stuff, like, consumer offset. However, most of this patch removes usage of "/" while creating zk paths, which to me seems to be a bit confusing.

Does Kafka retain pre-fetched messages for partitions that remain assigned to the same consumer after the rebalance? If not, that offsets a lot of the benefit this could provide.

By the way, for a similar pull request (https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/979) I was asked to create a Kafka Improvement Proposal document (https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/KAFKA/KIP-49+-+Fair+Partition+Assignment+Strategy).
@junrao @gwenshap Do you have time to review this patch? Thanks!
@apovzner, @becketqin: Any reason not to add this back? It will probably break a lot of user test cases if we don't have it.
@ijuma Thanks for the review. @junrao @guozhangwang Would you be able to take a look?
please review @gwenshap ?

Docs are good, tidy spaces are cool.
You mentioned PRs fail because of an error and I'm not sure what failed and which error? Do we have tests that rely on the exact spaces in the output?
LGTM. Sorry for missing this before.

So there are no tests that depend on the structure of the output (ie comma
or tab delimited sequence tests, etc). There was a period of a couple weeks
were builds would fail (without failing tests) because overall duration of
the build surpassed some high watermark 120mins). When I rebased a few days
ago and ran again everything finished within expected time (though I can't
explain why that is... I noticed other PRs saw the same behavior -- no
failed tests but build marked as failed bacause they took too long) AFAICT
things are good to go.

On Monday, March 7, 2016, Gwen (Chen) Shapira notifications@github.com
wrote:

> Docs are good, tidy spaces are cool.
> You mentioned PRs fail because of an error and I'm not sure what failed
> and which error? Do we have tests that rely on the exact spaces in the
> output?
> 
> â€”

_Christian Posta_
twitter: @christianposta
http://www.christianposta.com/blog
http://fabric8.io
LGTM
LGTM. Thanks for the patch @granthenke and for the review @ijuma
LGTM. cc @junrao @guozhangwang

@junrao I am not sure if the comment at 87 can be moved. I don't know in which case the checkpointed cleaner offset could be smaller than log's start offset. I don't think the scenario to be addressed by this patch can be the reason for comment at 87.
@junrao Thanks the review! Could you take another look?
LGTM
@junrao Do you see anything wrong with this one-liner?
You already know this, but it's a bit weird to use `KAFKA_JVM_PERFORMANCE` for this.
@hachikuji Thanks for the PR, I've completed my review. Also, conflicts with master need to be resolved.

@noslowerdna I believe Kafka consumers deliver pre-fetched messages if a partition is not reassigned. I imagine this would also be useful if other state is held in-memory by the consuming application.
+1, LGTM
@harshach, that's 3 reviews including your own. Would you like to merge this?
@SinghAsDev I don't think its enough to simply add a documentation warning, we should be able to avoid the message loss right? If we propagate a retryable error, would the client retry the send?
@fpj Thanks for the review. I updated the patch to use the versioned delete and handle the empty data edge cases.
+1 on the change except a minor comment on the test.
@becketqin can you address the remaining comments?
@ijuma Can you please help look into test failures? It seems that the failures occur after merging your pull request #2.

@ijuma @junrao @gwenshap Pinging for review. I have updated the KIP-4 wiki with the details around these requests/response [here](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/KAFKA/KIP-4+-+Command+line+and+centralized+administrative+operations#KIP-4-Commandlineandcentralizedadministrativeoperations-ACLAdminSchema).
@allenxwang Investigating now.

@gwenshap @becketqin one observation is that most of the log-specific configs in `KafkaConfig` are _namespaced_ with `log.`. Although we did not do that for `unclean.leader.election.enable`, `compression.type` and `min.insync.replicas` I think we can deal with those later. However for the newer ones from KIP-3x (`message.*`) configs we should probably namespace those in `KafkaConfig` under `log.` before the next release.

@junrao @ijuma Thanks for the comments. 

@jjkoshy  I have addressed Jun and Ismael's comments.
LGTM cc @jjkoshy
LGTM, cc @gwenshap (on top of reducing tech debt, this also improves efficiency of `MetadataCache` and and its usage by KafkaApis).
Completely agree, @jjkoshy. Having a list of name conversions from cluster config to logs is embarrassing :)
Thanks for the ping. Its pretty large, so I'll need few hours to review it. I'll try to fit this in this week.
Thanks. :)

LGTM. Thanks for all the work on this @hachikuji and the additional tests!

FYI: This needs to get in before I can update the Metadata response for KIP-4/KIP-36. 

We are really close to migrating all of the Requests/Responses under the KAFKA-1927 umbrella.
@allenxwang Sorry about that, the following should fix it: https://github.com/allenxwang/kafka/pull/3 . Looks like I managed to push code to my PR that was slightly different to what I had tested.

@ijuma @granthenke Thanks for the reviews!

@gwenshap I'm adding one more commit to remove the readFrom method as discussed above.
Review by @hachikuji and @gwenshap. Tests pass locally.
Does this patch need any docs updates?
As far as I understand, this makes the code behave in-line with our docs.
Thanks @ijuma. Just wanted to double check.
LGTM
@ewencp Addressed most review comments. Would be good to go for another pass.

@granthenke broker does propagate a retryable error for LeaderNotAvailableException. However, if topic creation takes longer or metadata is not successfully fetched for the topic within max.block.ms, the send will fail.
Thanks for the patch. LGTM
Ping @guozhangwang
@allenxwang : Could you also run the system tests with your patch? If needed, @granders can help you run your branch in Confluent's jenkins.
LGTM.
Merged to trunk.
LGTM
LGTM, thanks @mjsax!
LGTM, and validated w/ some of the system tests as well. Thanks @rajinisivaram!
/cc @hachikuji Do you want to review this & the associated KIP?

@jcustenborder After being able to trigger the failure on `testCommitFailure` a couple of times, now that I've added logging to try to grab stacktraces, I can no longer generate the error even after 100+ executions. Not sure if the error is actually related to this patch or it just triggers it in tests because it's timeout related. How frequent were the failures approximately? 1s seems like it should be enough, but I'm curious whether we could validate a fix simply bumping up the timeout to be a bit larger.
Ran `./gradlew -PscalaVersion=2.11 test` locally and tests passed. @gwenshap, maybe you can review this trivial change?
Review by @hachikuji and @ewencp
@ewencp I marked it as a blocker for now. What are your thoughts on the hard-coded approach used here versus getting the data from the server via the topic metadata?
There are some issues with this approach, closing for now.
Review by @ewencp
@hachikuji, I added a test.

@vamsi-subhash Thanks for the contribution.

Can you please open a jira to describe/track this work and update the PR to include it in the title? This PR also adds a few new configurations which warrants, at a minimum, a discussion in the Kafka dev mailing list. From there a small [KIP](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/KAFKA/Kafka+Improvement+Proposals) may be suggested too.
LGTM
LGTM
LGTM

With regards to system failures, they are:

```
test_id:    2016-03-08--001.kafkatest.sanity_checks.test_verifiable_producer.TestVerifiableProducer.test_simple_run.producer_version=trunk
test_id:    2016-03-08--001.kafkatest.tests.streams_smoke_test.StreamsSmokeTest.test_streams
test_id:    2016-03-08--001.kafkatest.tests.security_rolling_upgrade_test.TestSecurityRollingUpgrade.test_rolling_upgrade_phase_two.broker_protocol=SASL_PLAINTEXT.client_protocol=SSL
test_id:    2016-03-08--001.kafkatest.tests.compatibility_test.ClientCompatibilityTest.test_producer_back_compatibility
test_id:    2016-03-08--001.kafkatest.tests.upgrade_test.TestUpgrade.test_upgrade
test_id:    2016-03-08--001.kafkatest.tests.streams_bounce_test.StreamsBounceTest.test_bounce
test_id:    2016-03-08--001.kafkatest.tests.consumer_test.OffsetValidationTest.test_consumer_bounce.clean_shutdown=True.bounce_mode=all
```

I think these were all (transiently) failing in trunk based on the last time trunk was merged to this branch. @allenxwang, can you please merge from trunk again? The streams tests have since been disabled and `test_upgrade` has been fixed. It's particularly important that we know that it passes even after the changes in this branch. I will re-run the system tests once you do this.

Hi Grant,
Here is the JIRA https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-3359

The JIRA has the details. I have replied to the kafka-dev mailing list on the pull request mail thread with details. Please review and let me know of the comments. Thanks.
LGTM
@ijuma do you mind sharing the concerns?
LGTM!
Minor comment, otherwise LGTM!
Merged with trunk and run systemTest task on my laptop. No test failures.
Thanks for this @hachikuji, very important. :) I left a few comments, looks good otherwise.

Below was my original WIP message:

> Please see the email with the subject "Protocol Documentation WIP" in the Kafka dev mailing list for context on this PR. Do not review this for merge in its current state. 
> 
> Here are links for the generated output:
> - Gist of output: https://gist.github.com/granthenke/dae9e60b5e548acead58#file-kafka_protocol-html
> - In browser preview of Gist: https://rawgit.com/granthenke/dae9e60b5e548acead58/raw/02e93fae37381fbbeaf83d55e4b4c4083f87319b/kafka_protocol.html

I have updated the patch to be a "real" patch. The protocol docs still need some work. But that work is tracked by the umbrella jira here: [KAFKA-3360](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-3360).
@ewencp Ping for review. Thoughts on how this should link into the main docs?
@fpj Any further comments? @ewencp @gwenshap @junrao Could one of you review?

@ijuma Getting the list via topic metadata is definitely the _right_ solution. If it depends on some other patch, the hard coded approach might be a _good_ solution to address the immediate problem, and a follow up could always fill in the complete fix.
@ewencp @ijuma Agreed. Lets get a fix in and then follow up later once the metadata changes are made.
@Ishiihara Re-reviewing, but just FYI there are some merge conflicts so this needs updating.
I'll submit an update shortly to take care of the other comments on the PR.
@ewencp rebased against trunk.
LGTM

@ijuma Made some more improvements. In particular, I wanted to ensure that the groupId was always provided since otherwise it's difficult to follow logs which contain multiple consumer instances. I also tried to address the review comments.
